def.dt: :a usually roofed and walled structure built for permanent use (as for a dwelling)
:the art or business of assembling materials into a structure

entry.et: Middle English bilden, from Old English byldan; akin to Old English būan to dwell bower

def.dt: :to form by ordering and uniting materials by gradual means into a composite whole :construct
:to cause to be constructed
:to develop according to a systematic plan, by a definite process, or on a particular base
:increase enlarge
:to engage in building
:to progress toward a peak (as of intensity) build to a climax
:to develop in extent a crowd building
:to stimulate to vigorous action
:to make an integral part of build quality into the product
:to use as a foundation building on past experience
:a unit of construction or composition
:something essential on which a larger entity is based
:a building containing separate residential apartments called also apartment house

:a set of symptoms (as headache, fatigue, and eye irritation) typically affecting workers in modern airtight office buildings that is believed to be caused by indoor pollutants (as formaldehyde fumes or microorganisms) compare multiple chemical sensitivity
:to make an integral part of something
:to develop gradually by increments building up endurance built up a library
:to promote the health, strength, esteem, or reputation of
:to accumulate or develop appreciably
:to build cheaply and flimsily
